website_summaries.verdict: Funnels in three different sizes with narrow stems, perfect for filling bottles and containers of all sizes.
pros: Made with stainless steel and in varying sizes to fit all your kitchen needs
Each funnel's stem is perfectly narrow, and it works well with salt, spices and oils
It's easy to clean and comes with a clip-ring to bind them together
cons: Some complained that these funnels may stain and rust

customer_reviews.title: No air vent channel on 2 smaller funnels
customer_reviews.text: The text selling this funnel set says "Each funnel’s stem is equipped with an indent (air release channel), which allows funnels to vent and allows contents to flow better" - BUT only the largest funnel has the air release channel!! I bought these specifically for the smallest funnel to fill a bottle that continually has the air venting bubble up problem causing overflow. overall the set is nice BUT be aware only the largest funnel is as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Wise ShopperTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Poor design, not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I liked that this was metal, but your liquids and dry products, don't get to the bottom. Plus there is nothing on the sides to allow air to escape.
customer_reviews.author: D K

customer_reviews.title: TINY
customer_reviews.text: These are way too small and completely useless for what I wanted them for. If you are looking for itty bitty funnels, they are very well made and would be a good purchase. Was a waste of money for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice funnels; just not suited to my needs.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this set of funnels for a very specific purpose - to load powdered medicine into a syringe to administer meds to my cat. The way the funnels are constructed leaves a seam where the tube meets the bowl of the funnel. Some of the powdered medicine gets stuck at that point. The volume of powdered medicine being given is small, so the loss of any of it means my cat is not getting her full dose. Otherwise, they are very nice funnels and I'm sure I'd be quite happy with them if I was using them in a different application.
customer_reviews.author: KL

customer_reviews.title: Adorably Impractical
customer_reviews.text: The largest of these would be useful for pouring salt or pepper into shakers. The smallest would make a fine hat for GI Joe dressing as the Tin Man. Not suitable for liquids.
customer_reviews.author: calebtng

customer_reviews.title: will stain and rust
customer_reviews.text: not stain less. mine stained and rusted in a week
customer_reviews.author: P Lee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small glass bottles!
customer_reviews.text: These small stacking funnels are perfect for filling small bottles. I bought these to fill 2 oz glass amber bottles. The photo I included is the medium size funnel in the 2 oz bottle for size reference. It’s very easy to clean these up and restock them. They take up very little space and hook together with a ring so you don’t lose them. I’ve been using and cleaning these for over a month and haven’t noticed any rust or issues. I’m so pleased with these!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Lynn

customer_reviews.title: NOT one piece design, so food catches
customer_reviews.text: The stem is welded to the top piece, and has a ridge inside. Do they work? Yes, but food catches in them. It's just a poor design; cheap. Notice how the product photos by the seller are "Photoshop'd" in that area.
customer_reviews.author: Kirsten Johnson

customer_reviews.title: The picture is not the same design as the actual product.
customer_reviews.text: The picture did not match the product. I purchased this funnel because the picture showed a one-piece design with a smooth transition between the bowl of the funnel and the spout. The actual funnel is a two-piece design with a ridge between the bowl and the spout. It is difficult to use these funnels because the ridge traps liquids and powders forcing you to keep tapping the sides to get anything through . If you plan on using these for funneling anything smaller that a "BB", I would not recommend them. I am very disappointed with this Norpro product and I will not buy their products again.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: These funnels are perfect for filling our spice bottles. We get high quality spices online from Thrive Market, which charges 1/2 the price of what Whole Foods or HEB does. We know we'll use these funnels for many other things too. I thought nearly $10 was a little pricey, but it is stainless steel, so it'll last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: OneWayOnlyJesus

customer_reviews.title: Decent funnels for the money
customer_reviews.text: Descriptions/questions give a good view of the dimensions. My only issues are that there is a small lip or connection "bump" at the bottom of the funnel where the output part meets the conical funnel. This can create minor issues a times. It also lacks a depressed groove in the output tube to allow air to escape, necessitating holding the funnel a bit off the surface of the bottle or jar. Otherwise, very good.
customer_reviews.author: G. Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Love these tiny funnels!
customer_reviews.text: I have used these funnels for years and just bought another set because I give them away or lose them. They can easily be removed from the clip-ring for individual use. I like the thin material because they fit into small-neck containers, such as salt shakers. The vented stem allows contents to flow freely. The very short "handles" keep them from falling out of the containers being filled or turning them over. These are staple items in my kitchen supplies.
customer_reviews.author: inventive-cook

customer_reviews.title: Lip Where the Funnel Meets the Tube
customer_reviews.text: I have had these for two years. I use them often and can't wait to replace them. The one bad thing: There is a lip between the funnel and the tube. EVERYTHING gets stuck on it. So you have to stick your finger in there and push the herbs or oil or anything you are pouring through the funnel down the hole. It's dumb and annoying. In the end it makes the funnel not useful. And then cleaning them is also a pain because of this lip. The inside of the funnel DOES NOT LOOK LIKE THE PHOTO SHOWN. Everything else is fine. They are sturdy and three sizes is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Rangers

customer_reviews.title: Lip near at the bottom, preventing dry ingredients to funnel with ease
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to pour spices into glass containers, and they got the job done, but not with ease. There is a lip at the bottom of the funnel right before the spices would fall through the hole. Powdered spices built up there and I had to use a knife to push around the ingredients to get them down the funnel. These would work better for funneling liquids. The material is good quality and they are durable, so for the few times I will need to use them in a year, I’ll keep them. But I would not buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Katie L

customer_reviews.title: Work well, wish the lip was different
customer_reviews.text: They work well and serve the purpose I need them to, I just wish the inside lip wasn't manufactured the way it was. I've only used them for liquid so far, but I imagine dry will be the same. Some contents stays in the funnel no matter what, the lip keeps it in there. Not a big deal just bad engineering but at this price point I dont care.
customer_reviews.author: RockChalkJayhawk

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a funnel small enough to fit inside my little 1oz dropper bottles in order to easily refill them from a larger bottle. The smallest funnel fits down inside them and the funnel stem is long enough that the funnel stays in place without falling out while I pour. This was exactly what I needed! And I’m sure I’ll use the two larger ones as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra O

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: They arrived packaged fairly well, no dents or markings on them. But they are a lot smaller than I assumed, even after reading all of the product details. The smallest will basically just be useful for moving seasoning from one container to a smaller one. And the largest one is still smaller then I was thinking. But overall they are fairly good quality, and becuase of their smaller size they store really well in a drawer stacked on top of each other.
customer_reviews.author: Tasha Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Very nice. Perfect for filling bottles with small openings, like tincture bottles, or hummingbird feeders, etc.
customer_reviews.text: These are really nice, high quality funnels. Thought has gone into the design. A little indent in the side of the tube that goes into the bottle keeps air flowing into the bottle you are pouring into. That is a very nice touch. no more having to lift up the funnel to fix the vacuum that develops when pouring into a bottle with same diameter opening as the funnel tube. Also, dishwasher safe and cleans up well. These are SMALL, which is what I wanted. Check size before you order. These are great for filling tincture bottles.
customer_reviews.author: J. Garrison

customer_reviews.title: Like all Norpro items these are well designed and really ...
customer_reviews.text: Like all Norpro items these are well designed and really high quality in terms of being defect free. This includes three funnels that best together on a retaining ring. There is a weird ridge on the inside of the funnel tubes to keep them from getting stuck. It does sort of catch what you're pouring through and you have to kind of tap the funnel a bit to get it all to clear the tube. This is a FEATURE not a flaw, just be aware when you're cleaning to make sure you get the ridge inside the funnel neck.
customer_reviews.author: DrowsyKitten

customer_reviews.title: Tiny & it has to burp to drain - not functional - see video.
customer_reviews.text: Tiny funnels - they are terrible with liquid. The liquid has to burp to drop. Very frustrating. I should have paid closer attention to the size before buying, but I’ve never seen a funnel actually not operate like this one. See video.
customer_reviews.author: E.42.31

customer_reviews.title: These funnels are not what I expected. They are ...
customer_reviews.text: These funnels are not what I expected. They are really small I thought they were the regular size big ones. One measures almost 3x3 inches, the second on is about 2 3/16x 2 1/4 and the last one is about 1 1/4 x2 inches, so you will only be able to pour a little fluid at a time in the. But other than that the biggest one served my purpose, though I still need to get bigger ones. I hope this help you all CIAO!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Pu-er

customer_reviews.title: compact
customer_reviews.text: These a three small graduated funnels that are perfect for filling bottles. The wash up easily and since they are held together with a ring, they can be hung with a hook for easy storage. The smallest funnel could be used to fill perfume bottles or something similar while the large can be used to fill soda bottle sized containers. Just perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Polansky

customer_reviews.title: It gets clogged easily. The spout is getting Rusty now.
customer_reviews.text: I try to funner my protein, wheat grass, probiotics and other powder supplements. This does not work.
customer_reviews.author: OMAR DIAZ

customer_reviews.title: inner lip
customer_reviews.text: These have a significant rough horizontal lip on the inside where the cone is attached to the stem which prevents powder from flowing. You have to shake it around and scrape the remaining material from the lip into the hole.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Donahue

customer_reviews.title: Perfect. And oh so tiny!
customer_reviews.text: If I had paid attention to the description I would have realized that these are really really small for what I had in mind. It's ok though - I will use them for things like managing home made spices and refilling the pepper mill. Quite likely other uses will pop up now and then. Just know that if you are looking for funnels for tasks like pouring soup from a kettle into a jar, transferring sun tea from a gallon jug into a take-along bottle, or other similar situations that involve medium to large volumes, you'll want to double check the sizes on these before thinking this is the solution. But they are cute! So tiny, and so cute!
customer_reviews.author: Connie Schrag

customer_reviews.title: Very small and poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Small, smaller and doll-size. Yep I was duped also. Yes of course my fault for not reading more carefully, but also they are poorly made and poor materials. If it was good Stainless Steel then dishwashing would be fine, but they rust. Also not smooth transition from funnel to spout so powder (sugar, flour, etc.) get stuck and require a lot of tapping, etc. to get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: DJPinSF

customer_reviews.title: Yes they are small
customer_reviews.text: I was trying to pour a pan of iced tea into a gallon jug and making a mess. I picked up my phone, searched funnels and bought Amazon choice without researching and that was my mistake. These are ridiculously small. They do seem to be high quality. I should have returned them but was mad at myself for not reading product description
customer_reviews.author: Bob M.

customer_reviews.title: Bad surprise
customer_reviews.text: Argh! The spout for the largest of these funnels is smaller than ones I already have. I made mistake of "operating by the picture." Long and short, I was look for a large mouth funnel...and this is NOT one! Material looks a bit cheap and as if would not hold up. As to versatility...the three are so close to the same size, not really much versatility except between the largest and the smallest...and even that is limited.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Farkle

customer_reviews.title: Not as big as I was hoping
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to replace my plastic funnel that broke so I ordered these thinking the large one would do that and I could use the other two for salt /pepper and small stuff. Well thats not the case the large one is too small to do much. it does not hold enough in the top part and would take a long time to do my larger projects that I do.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: solid LITTLE funnels
customer_reviews.text: Overall, these are great little funnels. They are a bit smaller than I thought they would be, but my bad for not reading more closely. Other than the small size, I can't think of anything to change. They work really well and feel incredibly sturdy. I anticipate having these guys for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Santa

customer_reviews.title: Funnels
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was recommended from a vape shop owner to be able to fill my plastic smaller bottles with in order to fill my ecig tanks with e-juice. I use them quite often to pour the very large bottles of e-juice into these smaller bottles to make it easier to fill my different tanks and am so glad that I did as I use them all the time and they are very well made.
customer_reviews.author: anna

customer_reviews.title: Stainless Funnels
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice set of stainless steel funnels. They are nicely made and very useful sizes. Also, it's nice that they fit together and are attached to one another so they don't get lost. They fit nicely into drawers.
customer_reviews.author: Joan

customer_reviews.title: A Perfectly Equipped Kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I prefer the cleanliness and durability of these stainless steel funnels for making hand sanitizer..
customer_reviews.author: Pekemom

customer_reviews.title: Great for Liquid, not so great for powders/spices.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to help me pour my Penzey Spices into the glass bottles. Due to the ridge in the metal you have to tap, tap, tap to get all the spice in. Even then it collects on the ridge. These would work great for liquids, but not so good for spices. I will have to see if I can find something that does not have a ridge/lip.
customer_reviews.author: Cariann Pafford

customer_reviews.title: I bought a second set so I'd have them for both kitchen & garage use.
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid set of small stainless steel funnels. I liked them so much I bought a second set so now I have three funnels in my kitchen, and another three in my garage. My neighbor is a retired mechanic, he got a set and uses them everyday. I'd pay double the price and be perfectly happy.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Nice LITTLE funnels but,....
customer_reviews.text: Nice little funnels. I was shocked upon their arrival at how profoundly tiny they are! I must have missed something in the description. They are fine for what they are but, are not at all what I expected to receive. Using them (so far only the 'largest' of them) I swear I feel almost amused that this must be some flip into the world of Alice in Wonderland or Gulliver's Travels. But! They are a start in trying to stay away from plastics when working with food & anything potable.
customer_reviews.author: Ceall A O

customer_reviews.title: Kitchen use sizes. Sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect sizes for pouring liquids into travel containers or for kitchen use. Love that they are so sturdy and not cheap plastic. I got them just a couple days after ordering which was ahead of schedule. Excellent product. Excellent seller.
customer_reviews.author: Irish Lark

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended for bead handling.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these not for food handling, but for transferring bagged beads to bead tubes. Unfortunately, the flattened bottom of the funnel where it attaches to the tube doesn't let the last of the beads fall through as they catch and sit on the flattened area. Takes a hard shake to knock them into the tube to fall through. Will toss these in my kitchen drawer and look for a different option for my crafting needs.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy S. Herdman

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff, one has an air exit groove.
customer_reviews.text: These are tiny things; I know they have posted all its sizes in the product description but still can surprise you once it's in your hands. These are just some of those additions to our plastic free kitchen/life. We love it.
customer_reviews.author: Ron B.

customer_reviews.title: Great for blending essential oils!
customer_reviews.text: Nice little funnels for blending my essential oils and carrier oils. I find them extremely useful. A word of caution however, take them off the ring before using them, I ended up spilling a large amount of very pricey chamomile eo >insert many tears< because I left the funnel on the ring and it tipped over. On the bright side, my house smells wonderful and the dogs are calm af!
customer_reviews.author: Somebodys Mother

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: It's nice to have this in the kitchen. I use it to pour salt and sugar from the larger container to the dispenser on the table. They work great. There is a set of 3 on key ring. These funnels are made in China.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Las Vegas

customer_reviews.title: Great Funnels
customer_reviews.text: I use these for home bottling as I make my own "spirits" and they work great going from bottle to oak barrel and back to bottle after aging is complete. Also work well for bottling. The stack nicely so they don't take up much room when not in use. Strong buy recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell G.W.

customer_reviews.title: No. Just no.
customer_reviews.text: These are nice quality but there are lips on the inside bottom of the funnels. I’m trying to pour powder but some gets stuck around that lip and makes a mess when removed. I’m better off using my cheap plastic ones I’d return but threw away the box already.
customer_reviews.author: AmazingSupergirl

customer_reviews.title: Read description. I didnt. They a very small.
customer_reviews.text: I requested a refund. Not because of poor quality or anything negative. I gave a 5 star regardless. They were totally fine... just waaay too small for what I would use them for. Clearly I did a rush buy and didnt read the description.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needed To Fill Small Bottles
customer_reviews.text: I use these Norpro Stainless Steel Funnels (3-pack) to safety fill small bottles with Isopropyl Alcohol and H2O2. No spills when you take your time doing this! I have to have these on hand to spray down germ filled keyboards, phones and public doorknobs. They fit the purpose I needed them for. Enough said. FINALLY, some small functional funnels (say that 3 times fast)!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Non-GMO Foodie Biker

customer_reviews.title: Needed for dishwasher rinse aid
customer_reviews.text: My dishwasher has a very tiny opening for putting in the rinse aid and at least twice as much pours all over the dishwasher door than what you can put in the dispenser. I got these tiny funnels to avoid wasting so much rinse aid. Works great using the tiniest funnel.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Very nice funnels
customer_reviews.text: I bought these thinking I would use them for pouring powder when reloading. Well, they won't work for that since they hold powder around the edge of the spout. That said, they are very nicely made and should work grwat for the uses intended by the maker.
customer_reviews.author: A. C.

customer_reviews.title: Good, Small funnels
customer_reviews.text: These are great to use and easy to clean. I used them for filling my tincture bottles. The circle hoop connecting them, I believe was done to keep them together, but it is a bit annoying to separate one funnel off, to use and then clean them. I just keep that with them in a sandwich zip lock bag, and they stay clean and fine.
customer_reviews.author: Anna MG Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Small
customer_reviews.text: I received this product assuming that they would be normal sized stainless steal funnels, however, they’re very small. I don’t know how you could use them they’re so small.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Funel of all sizes
customer_reviews.text: Goof for kitchen purposes, creating skincare items and distribute with a funnel, Its sturdy. Easy to wash. You get a ring to keep all funnels together you can hang as a style in your kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia D.

customer_reviews.title: Such small funnels
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I found these small funnels. They have come in handy more than once. They are made well, very sturdy stainless steel and I welcome them into my menagerie of quality stainless steel utensils/kitchen gadgets
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Critique

customer_reviews.title: Thought I needed them for one or two things... use them more than I thought
customer_reviews.text: from mixing/filling spice jars, pouring oil into dispensers, filling bitters bottles with homemade bitters, filling flasks... you'll find uses if you do much DIY in the kitchen/bar.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Forde

customer_reviews.title: Stainless steel funnel set
customer_reviews.text: They are smaller funnels than I expected but that’s ok because I actually needed a set of smaller funnels and the largest one is big enough for most jobs in the kitchen. It’s not like I need funnels in my kitchen like I’d be using in my garage.
customer_reviews.author: Steven H.

customer_reviews.title: Itty Bitty, extremely tiny
customer_reviews.text: I was eagerly awaiting these funnels and upon seeing them, they r itty bitty, Extremely small! And steel is pretty thin, this is no good.
customer_reviews.author: Candace D.

customer_reviews.title: Seems Good to Me
customer_reviews.text: They are funnels... they work. They are sturdy and appear well made and I like the variety of small sizes for more precise funneling jobs such as spices, oils and things in the kitchen and I bought a separate set to use for automotive and yard chemicals.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and cleans up easy!
customer_reviews.text: I like the 3 different sizes. I Love that they are stainless steel. They clean up nice in warm soapy water and then rinse.They handle well!
customer_reviews.author: CeeCee

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than expected, but high quality
customer_reviews.text: These are really only ideal for ground spices or thin liquids. They are VERY small, but very good quality. Not worth the price unless you have a very specific need for SMALL funnels.
customer_reviews.author: Lalita

customer_reviews.title: This is a great set of small funnels
customer_reviews.text: This is a great set of small funnels. The price is right, and they are good quality. They are durable, and they work. They have held up to repeated use. I recommend a pipe cleaner to clean the necks if you are having problems. I will note the small necks mean you have to pour very slowly. Thicker liquids will have a tougher time through the smallest funnel. Nothing too problematic, but something to keep in mind as you are deciding what to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: A. Duramonov

customer_reviews.title: high quality
customer_reviews.text: These are nice, high-quality funnels. The build quality is excellent and they feel nice and sturdy, with nice polished surfaces. Just be aware of the size - for me, in real life they seem smaller than how they appear in the picture. That said, the measurements are clearly stated on the product page and are correct; just make sure that you realize these are pretty small. Even the largest one seems small and the smallest one seems tiny! They do the job for me, though - I deliberately wanted smaller funnels. As I said, read the measurements and make sure they meet your needs.
customer_reviews.author: monkuboy

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: These are well made and a perfect group of funnels. They ARE smaller than I thought they would be, but that's MY perception, not their problem.
customer_reviews.author: desertfox

customer_reviews.title: Size Matters
customer_reviews.text: They are small. Images can be misleading to the hasty shopper. If they were to place a ruler next the item sales would decline. A good set. A small set.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I clean them as soon I'm to use it. Great quality and size. I received them on time. I use them to fill my small bottles for spices and my small bottles for essentials oils.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Great quality funnels
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these funnels to fill a jar with olive oil. They are very small, but work really well. They are great for small openings. I also love that they are stainless steel so no need to worry about rust. I see these lasting a long time. I am also finding other places in my kitchen where small funnels are useful beyond my original purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: I like the ring clip they included so that funnels or ...
customer_reviews.text: I like the ring clip they included so that funnels or whatever else can be added or removed for use. It makes for a nice organization so you do not lose your funnels to the abyss that is your drawer. Noticed that the big funnel has crimp-in which I would assume helps with regulating the air flow as you pour. Or perhaps it is the deep seas, lost-to-time crimp that now haunts your dreams. My sanity points are easily shaken by the sheer mystery of kitchen utensils.
customer_reviews.author: Couches

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SET!
customer_reviews.text: These are great little funnels and the ring that keeps them together is a nice addition, since they are small and could easily get lost. I purchased this set to fill the 2oz & 4oz cobalt blue dropper bottles ( the middle size is perfect for this. Their construction is sturdy and they are well made. I am sure they will last a long time. So glad I decided on this set.
customer_reviews.author: Gracean Hope

customer_reviews.title: Leaves a ring of dry goods in funnel.  But nice quality
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality - no sharp edges and a nice weight of metal. Spout on the wide one is big enough to handle the volume from the cone and lets dry items pour easily. Downside is the joint where the spout connects to the cone. There's a noticeable lip so dry, fine items, like seasonings, salt, sugar etc get stuck at the end. This leaves a ring of the item behind and requires shaking the funnel to have it all finally drop in.
customer_reviews.author: pragmatismrules

customer_reviews.title: Annoying notch at the nozzle
customer_reviews.text: They're just ok. There is a notch at the nozzle top so if you are funneling grains, they often get stuck on the notch. They could've done a better job with that. Beyond that, these seem pretty durable for what it's worth.
customer_reviews.author: linuxguy

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Easy to use, good sizes, zero plastic product (though I wish it didn't come wrapped in lots of plastic, ugh).
customer_reviews.author: Happyxjw

customer_reviews.title: Great funnels for making scented oils or waters!
customer_reviews.text: I especially like the variety of sizes, I have used them all for different purposes. Really easy to clean, and still look new after over a year. I recommend them to anyone who needs a small funnel for their creations.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: SMALL!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was rather disappointed when I got this today. I was SHOCKED at the size. The largest one is roughly 4 inches from the top of the rim to the bottom of the funnel. They are basically miniature funnels...
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Goins

customer_reviews.title: Very nice little funnels
customer_reviews.text: Very nice little funnels. May family uses this to refill our glass bottles with oil and other condiments. These are very easy to clean - simply use soap and water. Even after repeated uses, they showed no signs of rusting or tarnishing. These will certainly last you a lifetime. Will recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Cuishii

customer_reviews.title: They are what they purport to be........
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, sturdy and very handy to use when you need to fill small containers/bottles. Recommend if this is what you need to do, good value.
customer_reviews.author: Ed B.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for small stuff. But this is what I was looking for, so it does what I want it to. They are stainless steel and are sturdy enough, all clip on to a ring, but can easily be removed to use separately.
customer_reviews.author: michael benedict

customer_reviews.title: Does not empty
customer_reviews.text: The design is very poor as the funnel does not drain completely. You will be left with some residues around the neck. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Marcel

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and space saving
customer_reviews.text: My fiancé made hot sauce and these were perfect to poor the sauce into the bottles. We thought we’d only use them for the hot sauce, but we use them regularly. Definitely a good investment. I really like the ring they come on. We store them in a drawer on the ring. Each of the funnels fit into one another nicely so they don’t take up much room.
customer_reviews.author: Theodora D Mucha

customer_reviews.title: These are a perfect size for adding essential oils to small glass jars ...
customer_reviews.text: As the description says, they are small. These are a perfect size for adding essential oils to small glass jars and for pouring liquids into narrow-mouthed bottles. I also love that they are stainless steel, rather than plastic. They do fine in the dishwasher and nest for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Ettie81

customer_reviews.title: Thought it was bigger.
customer_reviews.text: I thought this product would of been a little bigger than this. I can see right now I will be over flowing this funnel
customer_reviews.author: Shaborn

customer_reviews.title: Small
customer_reviews.text: I did not read the dimension on these 😏 my fault. A little small good for filling bottles and they are stainless steel (trying to get rid of plastic ones) overall I really like them and will get great use out of them.
customer_reviews.author: eAngel

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Very Small Funnels
customer_reviews.text: These are small stainless steel funnels And I use in my business including to access very small mouth jars and lip balm tubes. I needed all metal funnels which do not absorb (like plastic does) ans metal can be cleaned easily and sterilized. These are great for my needs. Rating 5 stars = love it.
customer_reviews.author: ChristineMM

customer_reviews.title: what I hoped for
customer_reviews.text: This funnel set is both nice looking and functional. The three small sizes will help me fill jars around the house. The children can also play with them without hurting anything, and they are dishwasher safe. The set comes with a key ring type clip to keep them all together, or separate for use. I keep the key clip on the smallest one for dishwashing, so it doesn't fall through the rack. The smallest funnel allows me to fill a glass bottle I use for dispensing sesame/olive oil. The oil jar I use has a very small lip for rationing onto toast as a replacement for butter.
customer_reviews.author: a young mom

customer_reviews.title: Stainless steel conducts heat!
customer_reviews.text: Sizes are a wee bit small. Also, I bought this to safely decant hot boiled water into bottles. It becomes too hot to touch after a short session of pouring!
customer_reviews.author: mukuge

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy funnels
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my elderly mom so she could use the smallest one to pour vinegar into her catheter tubing to clean it. She was spilling a lot of vinegar, and the tiny funnel actually fits into the tube. You can also safely clean metal by soaking it in bleach. (I will use the other two funnels for pouring spices into smaller containers, and keep them for myself.)
customer_reviews.author: A. Loftus

customer_reviews.title: Good quality funnels!
customer_reviews.text: My husband was very pleased with the order. It arrived on time, and packaged real good.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Too small for my needs
customer_reviews.text: These are very small, be sure to read dimensions first as the pictures show them to be larger. I will keep them as I am sure there will be a use some day for a small funnel.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J. Mason

customer_reviews.title: I'm generally pleased with them though
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for small funnels that I could use to put carrier and essential oils into 1 oz. and 1/2 oz. bottles without getting oil all over the place. These seem to fit the bill. The only thing I should have considered is how far down they sit in the bottles themselves. That can cause some overflow problems if I'm not careful. I'm generally pleased with them though. At least they're easy to clean!
customer_reviews.author: Julia S.

customer_reviews.title: Too Cute!
customer_reviews.text: I have to give it 5 stars because they are too darn cute. They were not what I was looking for, but they will be handy. They are "small" so don't think you're going to get a funnel that will fill a large container. It will work great for re-filling my salt and pepper shakers and other spice containers I have. I think the largest is about 3 inches in diameter. For me, they will be functional. Mostly, I got a good chuckle!
customer_reviews.author: Zaba

customer_reviews.title: Love these funnels
customer_reviews.text: These funnels are perfect for what I needed. I am using them to fill bottles and flasks. They are easy to clean and to sterilize. The smaller one fits in the end of a large straw and I have actually used it with a straw to fill something from a distance. If you're looking for standard size funnels, these will probably be too small for you. Liquids pour pretty fast through them so the larger one may still work. Just be sure to pay attention to the size of these before you order to make sure they will fit your needs.
customer_reviews.author: Sandorae

customer_reviews.title: high quality
customer_reviews.text: If you want something that is going to last. This is the one for you. Perfect for filling those small opening containers.
customer_reviews.author: claybaby

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for a while now and I use them quite regulary. They work great for filling small jars and bottles. I haven't had any issues with them. I would recommend these if you are looking for small funnels.
customer_reviews.author: A.B.

customer_reviews.title: Solid product.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent little funnels for filling bottles, etc. They seem sturdy enough to stand up for life. I use them to fill baby bottles and other small applications.
customer_reviews.author: ThatCat

customer_reviews.title: I would like these a lot better if the funnel and the ...
customer_reviews.text: I would like these a lot better if the funnel and the stem were made from one piece. I use to buy metal funnels made from one piece. A drop or two does not drain through the stem.
customer_reviews.author: R. Petry

customer_reviews.title: Good price good product
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, they are funnels... did what I bought them to do! No complaints!
customer_reviews.author: NeedRangeTime

customer_reviews.title: These really put the 'fun' in funnel!
customer_reviews.text: I am able to but chug all kinds of the various beverages with ease and I'm getting better at handstands. Thanks stainless steel
customer_reviews.author: Cool Beans

customer_reviews.title: NOT smooth on inside
customer_reviews.text: From the first pictures of the product, the inside of the funnels look smooth, great! Just what I need to get crushed medications into a syringe for baby! Only NO, not smooth, look at customer pictures and you'll see a big lip on the inside shere the funnel connects to the neck. Powdered medicine gets stuck here. Back to the drawing board...
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Partridge

customer_reviews.title: So very pretty but not very practical
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these to use with dog food and a treat ball. Measurements were accurate - too accurate. I can only fit one piece of kibble down the funnel at a time. These are not good for the ONE reason I bought them, but, I will keep them. They are very pretty with a nice polish and sturdy. They will work great with spices and nut meals (or grain flours) and liquids and oils. The nice long spout will help ensure no mess. Very nice but obviously not meant for anything granular, like dog food!
customer_reviews.author: Angela Stoutenburgh

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Number one seller in funnels! Leave it to Amazon to have a funnel category. These mini funnels cover 99% of my funneling needs. I like that they are on the binder ring, but you cannot nest them together and put them on the ring at the same time, which causes them to take up a little bit of extra space. They've held up for me since 2012 - no breaks, no rust, doesn't seem like anything is getting caught it the (tiny) seams. I've been very happy to have them around.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. K

customer_reviews.title: Tiny funnels
customer_reviews.text: I make homemade vanilla extract every year and these funnels were exactly what I needed to finish the job off without making a massive mess. These are the perfect size for pouring the extract into 2 oz, 4 oz and 8 oz bottles.
customer_reviews.author: Meagan

customer_reviews.title: Stainless funnels
customer_reviews.text: From the picture onr cannot see these are very small funnels. They are nice, just smaller than i expected
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Good funnels, but limited uses
customer_reviews.text: I got these to be able to do various things in the kitchen, from pouring used cooking oil into a bottle, to pouring sugar into homemade lemonade, to adding spices and various ingredients to cooking... They're fine, I love the stainless, and they are fine quality - but they are TINY. And, they have a sort of flattened bottom before the spout, so they work better with liquids than with grains or powders. I tend to only use the largest one of these. I'm now looking for a set of stainless funnels that are bigger and more suitable for multiple usages.
customer_reviews.author: LAllyn

customer_reviews.title: Great tools for essential oil projects
customer_reviews.text: This is my second set and I hope to order another. I LOVE these. To me they are valuable. Thank you for having them available to us to purchase so I can use then with My essential oil projects
customer_reviews.author: Dana

product_meta.title: Norpro Stainless Steel Funnels, Set of 3
product_meta.description:
Size:Pack of 1| Style Name:FunnelsMeasures: 3" x 3" x 3" / 7.5cm x 7.5cm x 7.5cm
Set of three stainless steel funnels:
Large Mouth: 2.75" / 7cm Stem: .5" / 1.25cm
Medium Mouth: 2" / 5cm Stem: .4" / 1cm
Small Mouth: 1.5" / 3.8cm Stem: .20" / .5cm
Each funnel has a perfectly narrow stem, ideal for filling small bottles and containers while keeping the kitchen counter free from spills. Perfect for adding salt, pepper to shakers, transferring essential oils, oils to a cruet, powdered spice, herb vinegars into small decorative bottles for gifts and much more!Also great for auto care, cleaning, restaurants, schools and labs! Durable stainless steel construction funnels include three sizes, easy to clean, nest nicely and come with a clip-ring that keeps them together for storage. Dishwasher safe.

 Norpro was founded in 1973 with a vision to design, manufacture, and supply the highest caliber kitchenware. Norpro’s offering of innovative, high quality product for cooking, preparing and serving food are produced with superior materials and craftsmanship.
feature_bullets: Each funnel has a perfectly narrow stem, ideal for filling small bottles and containers while keeping the kitchen counter free from spills. Each funnel’s stem is equipped with an indent (air release channel), which allows funnels to vent and allows contents to flow better. Perfect for adding salt, pepper, herbs or spices into shakers or jars; transferring oils and vinegars into cruets or small decorative bottles for gifts; adding powdered drink mixes into water bottles and much more!
Durable stainless steel construction funnels include three sizes, easy to clean, nest nicely and come with a clip-ring that keeps them together for storage.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
